sect1.title: ItemCmdletProvider
sect1.para: The ItemCmdletProvider supports items referred to by path names. This provider does not distinguish between container-like items (HDF5 groups) and leaf items. It also has no concept of navigation. Items can retrieved, cleared, or invoked, i.e., a default action performed.
The following HDF5 entities are treated as PowerShell items by PSH5X:

sect2.para: Gets the HDF5 item at the specified location.

The Get-Item cmdlet gets the item at the specified location. It does support multiple path names and the wildcard character '*' to retrieve all matching items. This cmdlet does not retrieve the content of an item, such as the value of an HDF5 dataset.
The -Detailed switch can be used to retrieve additional information about an item.

example.title: Retrieving the root group of the HDF5 scratch PSDrive
example.screen:
PS:1 > Get-Item h5tmp:\ | Format-List
PSPath : HDF5\HDF5::h5tmp:\ PSParentPath : PSChildName : h5tmp: PSDrive : h5tmp PSProvider : HDF5\HDF5 PSIsContainer : True LinkCount : 7 Timestamps : {ModificationTime, AccessTime, ChangeTime, BirthTime} AttributeNames : {attr1} AttributeCount : 1 ItemType : Group

example.title: Retrieving more details about the root group of the HDF5 scratch PSDrive
example.screen:
PS:1 > Get-Item h5tmp:\ -Detailed | Format-List
PSPath : HDF5\HDF5::h5tmp:\ PSParentPath : PSChildName : h5tmp: PSDrive : h5tmp PSProvider : HDF5\HDF5 PSIsContainer : True Mounted : False MaxCreationOrder : 0 LinkCount : 7 StorageType : SymbolTable ReferenceCount : 1 ObjectID : 33554432 AdditionalMetadata : {ForAttributes, ForObjects} Header : {Version, Space, ObjectHeaderMessageCount, ObjectHeaderStatus...} FileNo : 4 CreationPropertyList : {Estimates, LinkCreationOrder, ObjectTimeIsTracked, AttributeStoragePhaseChangeThresholds...} Address : 96 Timestamps : {ModificationTime, AccessTime, ChangeTime, BirthTime} AttributeNames : {attr1} AttributeCount : 1 ItemType : Group

sect2.para: Changes the value of an HDF5 item to the value specified in the command.

Changes the value of an item to the value specified in the command. The behavior of the cmdlet depends on the type of the item referred to by -Path. Currently, the following kinds of items are supported:

listitem.para: For chunked HDF5 datasets, Set-Item lets the user reshape a dataset within the limits of its maximum extent. The -Value must be convertible to an Int64 array whose length matches the rank of the dataset's HDF5 dataspace.
Change the HDF5 path name value of an HDF5 soft link. The -Value argument must a string.

Change the file name and HDF5 path name value of an HDF5 external link. The -Value argument must be a string array of length 2. The first element is used to set the external link's file name and the second element is used as the HDF5 path name.

sect2.para: The Clear-Item cmdlet deletes the value of an HDF5 item, but it does not delete the item.
The Invoke-Item cmdlet performs the default action on the specified HDF5 item. For example, for and HDF5 image this cmdlet may invoke an image viewer.
